text:
Hi folks.
I need advise about own widget.I created own widget at HubSpot and want to provide some paid services. And i have to determine for which user rendered my widget.
For enable widget i send request with static url to widget.
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/extensions/calling/111/settings> 
POST body:
{
  "name": "VS Panel",
  "url": "<https://own-widget.info/new-widget>",
  "width": 400 ,
  "height": 600,
  }```
How i can determine user id of customer who use my widget?
Request from CRM to my service for widget not contained any identifiers (like token in headers, etc)
Hello fellow developers!, I've got a bunch of unused audible credits - does anyone have a recommend book that would be a good listen? Personal development/fiction/non-fiction - I'm open to anything!
Project Hail Mary by Andy Weir was really good
If you want something long + good: Wanderers by Chuck Wendig
Salt by Mark Kurlansky is surprisingly good
I've been enjoying _Hyperfocus_ from Chris Bailey thus far. Also <@UDHT6N5SM> I was literally about to suggest Salt lmao
If youre into some low barrier-to-entry, extremely compelling/descriptive fantasy - I would recommend anything by Patrick Rothfuss. “The Name of the Wind” is and excellent starting place.
